reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a clean little Super 8, very convenient to get to off of the interstate, room was exactly as described, bed was very comfortable. Check in was a breeze, nice desk agent. Looks like they had recently done a renovation. Bathroom was SUPER clean, I did not see one hair. I am a GM of a hotel, and know how hard it is to make sure there is no hair in a room, housekeeping is doing a great job! I would recommend anyone to stay here, there were higher rated hotels, but for a 1 night stay just travelling thru, it worked out very well! Thanks Super 8!
reviews.title: Clean hotel, good place to lay my head for the night!

reviews.text: 3 of us with a dog called in our reservation as we were traveling back from South Dakota. When we arrived they would not honor the price, demanding we pay in cash an extra fee for the dog. We specifically had reserved a non smoking room as I have asthma. They refused to give us one because of the dog. The room was dirty and the smell was unbearable. Bottom line, we left. We had to get the refund through the booking cite we made the reservation through, since they refused to do so. And when I sent an email to Super Eight's main office, their attitude was each hotel is independently owned & operated so they didn't want to hear it, which put me off their brand entirely.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience of My Life

reviews.text: New carpet, nice room. A good place to stay, close to the highway and easy to get to other parts of town from.
reviews.title: Nice Place
Very Helpful Staff
reviews.text: Lots of trucks around, but I did not notice any noise that bothered with the stay. They also have an elevator, which I liked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rolled in late. They were fully booked. The night clerk, I think her name was Shawnda, was nice enough to call another nearby hotel to help find us a room. She indicated in the summer months that they get a lot of construction workers who can fill the local hotels up fairly often. I talked to a guy in the parking lot who was staying here. He said they're good about discouraging partying and such. The workers like that because after 10 to 12 hours on the job they want to sleep.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We arrived around 12:30am. We were tired. It was easy to access and check-in was a breeze. Basically just walked in and got our key card. Friendly. Beds were a blessing after being in the car for 11 hours. Clean room, bathroom was clean. Would recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Worth the advance booking discount

reviews.text: We had a great time at Super 8. The front desk was very nice and always had a smile. The breakfast was good and our kids had fun. Thank you.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night in mid-June, 2013, on a long road trip. The room was clean, spacious, and pleasantly decorated. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom roomy. We felt it was an excellent value. The only complaint I have is that there is a $1.50 charge for use of the safe and you must request that it be removed from your bill if you don't want to use the safe; they put it on automatically. I remembered the price I had gotten through my booking service and it wasn't quite the same. The desk clerk present when we arrived said, "oh, yes, that's probably the fee for the safe - mention it in the morning. We cannot remove it until then." So I did - but the morning desk clerk was much more snippy about it, though she did remove it. So - if you are watching your pennies (and if you are staying at a Super8 and using Trip Advisor to look for good deals, you probably are) make sure they remove your "safe charge!"
reviews.title: Very pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve stayed at many Super 8 hotels and this one was way above average. I would even rank this one 2nd best in all we’ve stayed in. The facilities were clean and neat. The recent renovations have made the place quite attractive. There is even an elevator in this one. The room was large and well decorated and smelled clean. The price was excellent too. I doubt whether you could get more for your motel dollar in town than this. An easy stop off the interstate. Close to shopping and dining. We were even checked in and out by Julie, the front desk manager. She did a great job and was very friendly, courteous and helpful, as were the rest of the staff. The only con I had was the small breakfast area and limited food selection. But it was adequate so that was a minor detail. The microwave, fridge, iron and ironing board, and the hair dryer made up for that. Unless you need a swimming pool, this would be your best choice. Pets are allowed, but only in smoking rooms.
reviews.title: Super Gr8

reviews.text: We paid a total of $72 for a room with two queens. The rooms are spacious and it looks like everything has been recently updated. Everything was clean and the a/c was cold. The only complaint I have is with the cigarette smell in the common areas, but for the price (including breakfast) I can deal with it.
reviews.title: Can't beat the value for the price
